txt.en: 'You have been a tremendous help, both to me and to the people of Cliving. We all owe you a debt of gratitude for your fine service.\n\n'Reeve Athelward has sent word that he would personally like to thank you for your assistance in these matters. Go with haste! The Reeve's time is precious, and it is rare for him to pay heed to visitors of your stature.'

'[placeholder]? You must be the wise [placeholder] I have heard so much about. I simply must thank you... I could not be more pleased with the results of the investigation.

'To think that a coward would threaten my life with poisons rather than face me with their grievances in person... it sickens me. We must put these matters behind us, for further turmoil yet lies ahead for me and my people.

'Receive this reward, and please consider helping us further.'
Reeve Athelward has heard of your endeavours to help Walnoth investigate the crimes in Cliving.
Talk to Reeve Athelward at the Mead Hall of Cliving
Reeve Athelward resides at the Mead Hall at the north-east end of Cliving.\n\nReeve Athelward has summoned you before him to discuss matters that concern him and his people.
